title: 12 Years a Slave

awardEventDetails.for: Best Motion Picture of the Year
awardEventDetails.description: Brad Pitt - Dede Gardner - Jeremy Kleiner - Steve McQueen - Anthony Katagas (12 Years a Slave (2013) became the first film directed and produced by a black filmmaker (Steve McQueen) and also the first to be written by an African-American (John Ridley) to win the Academy Award for Best Motion Picture of the Year.)

items.eventTitle: Críticos de Cinema Online Portugueses Awards

awardEventDetails.title: 2014 Winner Director of the Year Award
awardEventDetails.description: Steve McQueen ("Director Steve McQueen captivates his audiences by challenging them with often unorthodox and unrelenting subject matter and technique. McQueen is a master of utilizing the senses to create the essence of his works. In his latest effort, 12 Years a Slave, audiences become integrally involved in the unbearably violent nightmare of a free black man, who is kidnapped and sold into slavery, eventually to return home to freedom. To Steve McQueen, a soaring talent who ranks among the greats with each directorial effort, the Palm Springs International Film Festival is proud to present him the 2014 Director of the Year Award.")

awardEventDetails.title: 2014 Winner Breakthrough Performance Award
awardEventDetails.description: Lupita Nyong'o (Lupita Nyong'o is outstanding as the exploited slave whose beauty attracts the attention of Michael Fassbender's vicious slave master. She delivers a raw and deeply moving performance that serves as the fulcrum for the film's message of the inhumanity of slavery.)

awardEventDetails.title: 2014 Winner Image Award
awardEventDetails.for: Outstanding Writing in a Motion Picture - (Theatrical or Television)

awardEventDetails.title: 2014 Winner AFI Award
awardEventDetails.description: (12 YEARS A SLAVE is a story amazing - and in no good way. Director Steve McQueen shines a bright light on the horrors of the past - a time when caged and tortured humans were fuel to the machine that is America. Ultimately, this true tale is one of survival, a screenplay written by John Ridley and resting firmly upon the shoulders of Chiwetel Ejiofor, who delivers a strong and soulful performance as Solomon Northup - a free man kidnapped and sold into slavery. His injustice is set against the breathtaking beauty of Southern landscapes, which only serve to enhance atrocities disgracefully forgotten - and never before depicted with such raw intensity.)

awardEventDetails.for: Best Actress in a Supporting Role

awardEventDetails.title: 2013 Winner WFCC Award
awardEventDetails.for: Best Male Images in a Movie

awardEventDetails.title: 2013 Winner Honorable Mention
awardEventDetails.description: Steve McQueen (Motivation of the jury: "This award goes to a director who is in complete control of his chosen mode of expression. The film succeeds at being at the same time both epic and personal. All too often a director can overshadow their own film, but here is someone whose presence doesn't force itself onto the film, but which still shines through in each editorial choice he has made. Quite apart from the beautiful craftsmanship, this film is uniquely courageous. The unexpected duration of certain close-ups never feels self-serving, as each shot contributes to the film as a whole creating the unique feeling and aura of 12 Years a Slave.")

awardEventDetails.title: 2013 Winner Aluminum Horse
awardEventDetails.description: Hans Zimmer (Motivation of the jury: "Hans Zimmer has mastered the style of classic musical storytelling. He combines the almost frighteningly epic with the sensitively delicate: from hand claps to symphony. He is daring, and it pays off!")

Palm Springs International Film Festival

2014 Winner Director of the Year Award
Steve McQueen ("Director Steve McQueen captivates his audiences by challenging them with often unorthodox and unrelenting subject matter and technique. McQueen is a master of utilizing the senses to create the essence of his works. In his latest effort, 12 Years a Slave, audiences become integrally involved in the unbearably violent nightmare of a free black man, who is kidnapped and sold into slavery, eventually to return home to freedom. To Steve McQueen, a soaring talent who ranks among the greats with each directorial effort, the Palm Springs International Film Festival is proud to present him the 2014 Director of the Year Award.")
2014 Winner Breakthrough Performance Award
Lupita Nyong'o (Lupita Nyong'o is outstanding as the exploited slave whose beauty attracts the attention of Michael Fassbender's vicious slave master. She delivers a raw and deeply moving performance that serves as the fulcrum for the film's message of the inhumanity of slavery.)

AFI Awards, USA

2014 Winner AFI Award
Movie of the Year
(12 YEARS A SLAVE is a story amazing - and in no good way. Director Steve McQueen shines a bright light on the horrors of the past - a time when caged and tortured humans were fuel to the machine that is America. Ultimately, this true tale is one of survival, a screenplay written by John Ridley and resting firmly upon the shoulders of Chiwetel Ejiofor, who delivers a strong and soulful performance as Solomon Northup - a free man kidnapped and sold into slavery. His injustice is set against the breathtaking beauty of Southern landscapes, which only serve to enhance atrocities disgracefully forgotten - and never before depicted with such raw intensity.)

Stockholm Film Festival

2013 Nominee Bronze Horse
Best Film
Steve McQueen
2013 Winner Honorable Mention
Best Film
Steve McQueen (Motivation of the jury: "This award goes to a director who is in complete control of his chosen mode of expression. The film succeeds at being at the same time both epic and personal. All too often a director can overshadow their own film, but here is someone whose presence doesn't force itself onto the film, but which still shines through in each editorial choice he has made. Quite apart from the beautiful craftsmanship, this film is uniquely courageous. The unexpected duration of certain close-ups never feels self-serving, as each shot contributes to the film as a whole creating the unique feeling and aura of 12 Years a Slave.")
2013 Winner Aluminum Horse
Best Music
Hans Zimmer (Motivation of the jury: "Hans Zimmer has mastered the style of classic musical storytelling. He combines the almost frighteningly epic with the sensitively delicate: from hand claps to symphony. He is daring, and it pays off!")
2013 Winner Audience Award
Steve McQueen
